articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Member of European Parliament
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Member of European Parliament 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Frank Engel, member of the European Parliament from the Christian Social People's Party of Luxembourg, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Talks Held between Korean, Romanian Party Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between Korean, Romanian Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here on Monday between delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Socialist Party of Romania.
					 Present there from the WPK side were Secretary Kim Yong Il, Vice Department Director Ri Yong Chol and other officials of the WPK Central Committee and from the opposite side members of the delegation led by Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Party Supreme Council.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the matter of further developing the relations between the two parties and on the issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Gift from Romanian Party Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Romanian Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting delegation of the Socialist Party of Romania.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Party Supreme Council who is leading the delegation, handed the gift over to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Monday.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys of European Countries Feted
articles.content:
Diplomatic Envoys of European Countries Feted
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Monday to mark the 10th anniversary of the DPRK visit by the top-level delegation of the European Union.
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of European countries and representatives of their cooperation missions here.
					
					 Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung and other officials of the ministry were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group Here
articles.content:
Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group Here
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Stefan Muller, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group, arrived here Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Hit by Dust Storms
articles.content:
DPRK Hit by Dust Storms 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Dust storms were observed in all areas of the DPRK Sunday afternoon, except North Hamgyong Province.
					 The density of the dust storm in Pyongyang was 253 micrograms per cubic meter.
					
					 Dust storms have persisted in some areas through Monday afternoon.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Exhibition to Be Held 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The 7th national scientific and technological exhibition in the field of machine designing will take place here from May 5. 
					 The exhibition will be divided into machine design, designing and processing support program, designing study and machine type design panels. The exhibition will involve a designing competition.
					
					 To be displayed in the exhibition hall are machine designs, machine type designs, three-dimensional machine design support programs, valuable papers, books, multi-media and so on contributed by officials, designers, creators, teachers and researchers at the machine designing and industrial art creation institutions and the fields of education and scientific research and workers and technicians of factories and enterprises.

articles.title: Production of Geothermal Equipment Starts
articles.content:
Production of Geothermal Equipment Starts
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Ryongsong Machine Complex of the DPRK began producing geothermal equipment based on cutting-edge technology.
					 The newly manufactured geothermal equipment is highly efficient energy-saving equipment capable of heating and air-conditioning buildings with geothermal water available anywhere in the country.
					
					 It is rich in resources of geothermal water and favorable for developing and using this water. Accordingly, when geothermal equipment are produced and introduced on a large scale, dramatic changes will take place in heating and air-conditioning industrial establishments, public buildings, dwelling houses, greenhouses and other structures.
					
					In January this year General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the complex and advanced the task and ways for manufacturing geothermal equipment based on cutting-edge technology in an indigenous way as required by the developing reality in which geothermal resource, a new kind of energy, is widely developed and used.
					
					 The complex finished the design of a cutting-edge compressor in a matter of less than 15 days in cooperation with the Mining Machinery Institute under the State Academy of Sciences and Hamhung University of Hydraulic Engineering.
					
					 Its Songun Compressor Shop satisfactorily ensured the processing and assembling of accessories requiring the highest precision, thus succeeding in the manufacture of a new type screw compressor in a matter of one month.
					
					 Such cutting-edge geothermal equipment will be mass-produced at all machine-building centers across the country.

articles.title: Magnesia Clinker Production Goes Up
articles.content:
Magnesia Clinker Production Goes Up
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- From the beginning of the year the DPRK's magnesia clinker production has increased 1.2 times compared with the corresponding period of last year.
					 The Tanchon Magnesia Factory has employed advanced technologies to boost the production.
					
					 The Songjin Fireproof Material Factory has raised the production 130 percent in the same period by operating the kiln at full capacity. 
					
					 The Taehung Youth Hero Mine and the Ryongyang Mine have reconditioned kilns for increased production.
					
					 Besides, the Tanchon Area Associated Mining Bureau has built new light burned magnesia bases.
					
					 The Tanchon area has large deposits of magnesite, as well as a port.

articles.title: Songjin Steel Complex
articles.content:
Songjin Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Songjin Steel Complex in the northern part of the DPRK has increased production of iron and steel based on domestically available fuel. 
					 The complex has been furnished with new production processes and updated the existing ones, while introducing advanced technologies in production.
					
					 The complex has played a big role in the country's steel production since the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Its workers blew up the oven of first-stage iron-processing, which claimed many lives before the liberation of the country, and built an electric furnace in a short span of time. In the first half of Juche 39 (1950), they produced tens of thousands of tons of steel and rolled steel.
					
					 Afterwards, they built medium rolling and oxygen workshops, reconstructed the fireproof material workshop on an expansion basis and laid material foundations for boosting rolled steel.
					
					 When the country was in hard time in the period of "Arduous March", the complex kindled the torch of a great upsurge.
					
					 In recent years, it streamlined the steel-making processes, including the oxygen fusion and smelting processes.
					
					 The complex greatly contributes to the country's steel industry with increased production of steel, rolled steel and goods of second-stage metal-processing.

articles.title: Nonmetallic Infrared Radiator Developed
articles.content:
Nonmetallic Infrared Radiator Developed 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Electronic Materials Research Institute of the DPRK State Academy of Sciences developed a nonmetallic infrared radiator.
					 The bar-type radiator quickly heats and dries things inside and outside.
					
					 It raises infrared radiation up to more than 90 percent, while adjusting the radiation band.
					
					 The new device, low in production cost, has good resistance to electric heat and economizes 30 percent of electricity at drying processes.
					
					 It has already proved effective in footwear and foodstuff factories.

articles.title: New Kimilsungia Cultivation Method Invented
articles.content:
New Kimilsungia Cultivation Method Invented
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Research Center has invented a new cultivation method of Kimilsungia.
					 The method is to inject growth hormone, 6-BA, into the flower.
					
					 It makes it possible to adjust the blossom-bearing period, while raising the flowering rate by more than 50 percent.
					
					 The new method is simple to use so that it can be employed at households.

articles.title: Flowering Shrubs in Mt. Myohyang Attracts Tourists
articles.content:
Flowering Shrubs in Mt. Myohyang Attracts Tourists
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- One of the spectacular sights in Mt. Myohyang is a scene of rhododendron yedoense shrubs growing in front of the Pulyong Pavilion attached to the Pohyon Temple.  
					 Many tourists make a stop there to take pictures of the beautiful flowering trees.
					
					 Among the shrubs is a 600-odd-year-old tree. It, two meters tall, opens its flowers early in May.
					
					 The flower of violet and pink colors is one of the Korean people's favorite flowers.
					
					 It, belonging to the azalea family, keeps its double blossom long.
					
					 It is seen in flowerbeds and parks. It is also cultivated as hedge.

articles.title: City Conspicuaous for Lighting at Night
articles.content:
City Conspicuous for Lighting at Night
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Songrim City, a city of metallurgical industry in North Hwanghae Province of the DPRK, is conspicuous for bright lighting at night. 
					 Streets of the city are lit in a peculiar manner centering around the mosaic depicting the great persons of Mt. Paektu. Public buildings, apartment houses and catering networks are decorated with diverse lights. 
					
					 Diverse lighting modes are introduced according to architectural styles of buildings to produce a maximum effect. They include overall, concentrative, close, dispersion and long distance lighting and upward projection. 
					
					 A new type of lighting, a combination of ever-changing projection, rhythm and light flux, has been realized in the city on a high level.

articles.title: Superior Education System of DPRK
articles.content:
Superior Education System of DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A new school year began in the DPRK on April 1.
					 Party and government officials showed up at schools to congratulate new comers together with teachers and their parents.
					
					 Illiteracy was abolished in the country in a short time after the liberation from the Japanese colonial rule. The DPRK government started the universal compulsory elementary education in 1956, universal compulsory secondary education in 1958 and universal compulsory eleven-year education in 1975.
					
					The eleven-year education system includes one-year pre-school education.
					
					 The education system remained unchanged even in the latter half of the 1990s when the country was undergoing severe ordeals.
					
					 In the United States, however, many schoolaged children do not know how to read and write.
					
					 In the country the expenditures on the educational field have decreased and the schooling expenses steadily increased.
					
					This year the tuition fee for the four-year public universities is 7.9 percent higher than last year, reaching over 7,000 dollars. With boarding expenses included, the total educational expenses amount to 16,000 dollars, about 24 percent higher than five years ago.
					
					 Private universities are thrice as higher as public ones in tuition fee.

articles.title: Anniversary of Visit to DPRK by Top-level EU Delegation Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Visit to DPRK by Top-level EU Delegation Marked
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The visit to the DPRK by a top-level delegation of the European Union marked a historic occasion in the development of relations between the DPRK and the EU.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article on the lapse of 10 years since the delegation's visit to the DPRK.
					
					 With this visit as an occasion, a new phase was opened in the development of the DPRK-EU relations and affirmative changes were made in the relations between the DPRK and regional countries, the article says, adding:
					
					 The normalization and development of relations between the DPRK and the EU is a fruition of the DPRK's independent and peaceful foreign policy and a striking display of its validity and vitality. This greatly contributed to raising higher the international authority and dignity of the DPRK and strengthening the position and role of the EU in Northeast Asia and the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Over the past 10 years there were frequent exchanges of high-level delegations between the DPRK and the EU and its member nations. Assistance to the DPRK has been made by the EU and its member nations and mutual exchange and cooperation are getting brisk in different fields.
					
					 The EU is now striving to develop relations with members of the world community while overcoming serious financial and economic crisis by the concerted efforts of its member nations.
					
					 The people of the DPRK pay attention to the EU which is strengthening its independence, solving the regional issues by its own efforts and paying interest to the development of the relations with the DPRK, and wish it fresh success in its activities.

articles.title: AINDF Manifesto to All People
articles.content:
AINDF Manifesto to All People 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Worker-Peasant Department of the C.C., the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front issued a manifesto to all the people on April 30 on the occasion of May Day, according to the Internet site "Kuguk Jonson".
					 The working people not only in the north but also in all countries of the world are wrapped in a festive atmosphere, the manifesto said, and went on:
					
					 But the toiling masses in the south are waging do-or-die resistance in streets and at their work sites under the slogans for the genuine emancipation of the workers and their vital rights. 
					
					 The prevailing situation calls upon all the working people to courageously turn out in a dynamic sacred struggle against the conservative group.
					
					 The manifesto contained the following slogans: Let us turn out in the actions for a true life worthy of a human being and the emancipation and rights of the toiling masses!
					
					 Let all organizations of the labor movement and working people turn out in the struggle against the conservative group and the "Grand National Party"!
					
					 Let us develop the toiling masses' actions into those for independence against the U.S.!
					
					 The struggle for independence against the U.S. precisely means a struggle for vital rights. Let us take the lead in the struggle for terminating the U.S. colonial rule!
					
					 Let us wage do-or-die resistance for the abrogation of the "south Korea-U.S. FTA" which brings the life of all the people to destitution and deprives the workers of their jobs!
					
					 Let us loudly chant the anti-U.S. slogans in every city, street and work site just as people held high candlelights in protest against the import of U.S. beef infected with mad cow disease!
					
					 Let all the people positively support the struggle of the toiling masses and consolidate the success made by solidarity and alliance in the April 27 by-election! 
					
					 Let us pave a new wide avenue for actions against the U.S. and the conservative forces as befitting the main force for the revolutionary movement and makers of history!
					
					 Just and sure to triumph is the cause of the working class to live as the master of the society and the master of their destiny.

articles.title: Naval Firing Exercise to Be Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Naval Firing Exercise to Be Staged in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Marine Corps Command is planning to kick off a naval firing exercise on Paekryong and Yonphyong Islands in the West Sea of Korea on May 3.
					 It was reported that air and naval forces including fighters, patrol craft, etc. would be involved in the exercise to be staged under the pretext of coping with the "provocation" from the north and observed by officers of the U.S. Marines.

articles.title: Ruling Party Criticized in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ruling Party Criticized in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Kukmin Ilbo on April 29 carried an editorial criticizing the "Grand National Party" driven into a crisis by its defeat in the election.
					 The defeat of the GNP in the April 27 by-election is a due estimation of the ruling party's incompetence and irresponsibility revealed to the people, the editorial said.
					
					 The GNP was defeated in No. 2 Pundang District, Songnam City of Kyonggi Province, where opposition candidates had never won since parliamentary constituency was set up there, and in Kangwon Province, an area controlled by the conservatives. This well shows the present crisis of the GNP, it said.
					
					 The representative and other leading officials of the GNP clarified their will to resign with the blame for the election returns, but such action cannot quell the raged people's mindset, the editorial said.
					
					 Untold are the crimes of the ruling party that has brought only sufferings to the people, it noted, adding that the GNP has no future any longer as it lost popularity.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government", the GNP and Chongwadae should lend an ear to the voices of the people, it warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Inhumane Deed Censured by French Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Inhumane Deed Censured by French Organization
						
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association on April 23 issued a statement denouncing the south Korean authorities for having kidnapped citizens of the DPRK in the West Sea of Korea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Association strongly condemns the south Korean authorities for having kidnapped and detained citizens of the DPRK in disaster and persistently forced them to "defect" to the south, instead of rescuing and helping them go back to their home on the principle of humanitarianism, and made all sorts of attempts to obstruct their repatriation, and demands an apology for such behavior.
					
					 This inhumane deed is aimed to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen and scuttle the north-south dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not seek national confrontation and division, going against the trend of the times but make sincere efforts to ensure detente and lasting peace of the Korean Peninsula directly related to world peace and security.

articles.title: Myanmar Newspaper on Ten-Point Programme of Great Unity of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Myanmar Newspaper on Ten-Point Programme of Great Unity of Korean Nation
						
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Myanmar newspaper City News on April 11 carried an article titled "Great banner of great unity of whole nation".
					 The article said:
					
					 The 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation advanced by President Kim Il Sung is a great political programme as it instills into all Koreans the patriotic idea that they should firmly unite themselves as one to pave the way for national reunification and indicates the orientation and ways for achieving the sacred cause of reunification by the concerted efforts of the nation.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo together with the ten-point programme as the three charters for national reunification that the Korean nation should hold fast to invariably no matter how the situation and circumstance may change in the future.
					
					 He set forth the five-point policy of great national unity, a strict embodiment of the President's idea on great national unity.
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration are declarations for national independence and great national unity.
					
					 The struggle for implementing the inter-Korean declarations is precisely the process of carrying into practice the ten-point programme and the five-point policy.

articles.title: Dutch Organizations Open Internet Homepage on DPRK
articles.content:
Dutch Organizations Open Internet Homepage on DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Netherlands and Songun Korea-Juche Centre and the Dutch Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy jointly opened Internet homepage on the occasion of the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 Posted on the homepage titled "Netherlands-DPRK" were news of the military parade celebrating the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea, the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival and other events commemorating the Day of the Sun and programs and animation files introducing the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Trinidad and Tobago
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Trinidad and Tobago
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "For Carrying Forward and Accomplishing the Socialist Cause" was published in booklet by the Rapid Print Publishing House of Trinidad and Tobago on April 18.
					 The work, published on March 13, Juche 81 (1992), January 20 and March 3, 1993, clarifies the idea that socialism in the DPRK is a genuine people's society and it is necessary to remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il in order to protect its socialism centering on the popular masses and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Bulletins on DPRK Issued Abroad
articles.content:
Bulletins on DPRK Issued Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea published the 75th issue of its bulletin under the title of "Kimjongilia".
					 The bulletin carried an article with a photo of Kimjongilia, an immortal flower, which said:
					
					 An authorized botanist of a country said that if a flower festival is to be held in the moon, Kimjongilia will be presented as the main flower of the earth, garden of humankind, together with Kimilsungia, a flower of the sun.
					
					 Kimjongilia was bred by Mototeru Kamo, a horticulturist of Japan.
					
					 He named this flower after General Secretary Kim Jong Il and presented it to the leader on his birthday in February 1988.
					
					 The bulletin cited data to tell about the fact that Kimjongilia was awarded special prizes, gold medals, diplomas and other highest prizes at international flower shows. It also noted that the International Society for Horticultural Science officially registered the flower as a new variety of Begoniaceae and Kimjongilia associations and Kimjongilia fanciers societies were organized and Kimjongilia greenhouses built in different countries and regions.
					
					 Kimjongilia festivals and shows have taken place before full houses in the DPRK and other countries amid the worldwide interest in this flower, the bulletin said.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna of Austria issued a bulletin on April 25, the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "KPA, invincible defender of DPRK's sovereignty" with a photo of Kim Jong Il acknowledging the parade ranks.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Failing to Draw Lesson from Chernobyl Accident
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Failing to Draw Lesson from Chernobyl Accident
 Moscow, April 30 (KCNA) -- The first deputy general manager of the Rosenergoatom Company of Russia at a press conference on April 26 criticized Japan for failing to draw a lesson from the accident at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
					 Japan has not coped with the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant because it failed to draw a lesson from the Chernobyl accident, he noted, adding that Japanese did not regard it necessary to make preparations to eradicate the aftermath of the accident.

articles.title: China Reiterates Its Principled Stand on Human Rights Issue
articles.content:
China Reiterates Its Principled Stand on Human Rights Issue
						
 Beijing, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Chinese side to the China-U.S. human rights dialogue, held in Beijing from April 27 to 28, reiterated the country's principled stand on human rights issue.
					 At the talks the Chinese side introduced the country's measures and achievements in improving and safeguarding people's livelihood, advancing the construction of democracy and legal system, and developing grass-roots democracy.
					
					 It said that the Chinese people are most qualified to speak on China's human rights situation and the Chinese judicial organs would continue to handle cases in accordance with law.
					
					 It also said that only through abiding by the spirit of equality and mutual respect can the human rights dialogue achieve positive progress.

articles.title: PLO Rejects US Warnings
articles.content:
PLO Rejects US Warnings
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Saeb Erekat, a member of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), resolutely rejected the U.S. warnings on April 28.
					 The U.S. threatened to apply sanctions against the Palestinians, taking issue with the efforts of the Palestinian National Authority to achieve national unity. In this regard he said that it is a vital issue for the Palestinians to achieve national unity.
					
					 This position will be supported by the international community, he added.

articles.title: Belorussian President Condemns Western Plots
articles.content:
Belorussian President Condemns Western Plots
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Belorussian President Aleksandr Lukashenko vehemently condemned the West for its plots against his country.
					 He accused the EU of providing funds to the dissident groups for the purpose of instigating the public to come out against the construction of a nuclear power plant.
					
					 The nuclear power plant will be built in Belarus and it will be beneficial to the children and future, he stressed.

articles.title: Iran's Navy to Increase Missile Range
articles.content:
Iran's Navy to Increase Missile Range
						
 Tehran, April 30 (KCNA) -- Iran is directing big efforts to increasing the strike capacity of the missile forces.
					 The deputy commander of the Iranian Navy said in an interview with a radio on April 27 that Iran's Navy would increase the range of its missiles.
					
					 "Based on possible enemy threats, increasing the range of these missiles has been carried out by Iran's committed experts," he added.

articles.title: Damage by Storms and Tornados Increases in US
articles.content:
Damage by Storms and Tornados Increases in US
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The damage caused by storms and tornados that hit the southeastern region of the U.S. is on the steady increase.
					 The death toll from the recent tornadoes has topped 300 by early Friday.
					
					 Several thousands lost their homes as their houses were destroyed and about 1 million are without electricity.

articles.title: Discussion on Issue of Confirming Caspian Sea Borders Proposed
articles.content:
Discussion on Issue of Confirming Caspian Sea Borders Proposed
 Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Kazakhstan proposed the countries bordering on the Caspian Sea to discuss the issue of confirming the boundary line in the waters of the sea and agreeing upon the width of the relevant territorial waters, etc. at a working group meeting for confirming the legal status of the sea held in Baku on April 26.
					 He also called for pushing forward the work to work out a protocol according to an agreement already signed in the security field of the Caspian Sea.

articles.title: Cuadros celebran el Primero de Mayo con los trabajadores
articles.content:
Cuadros celebran el Primero de Mayo con los trabajadores
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los cuadros directivos del Partido y el Estado celebraron significativamente con los trabajadores de distintas localidades del país el 121º aniversario del Primero de Mayo, día de los trabajadores de todo el mundo.
					Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Yang Hyong Sop y otros cuadros del Partido y el Estado, los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, ministerios, órganos centrales e instituciones locales del partido, el poder y entidades de masas visitaron el Complejo Termoeléctrico de Pyongyang, el Complejo Químico Juventud de Namhung, el Complejo Siderúrgico de Hwanghae, el Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean, la Granja Cooperativa de Migok de la ciudad de Sariwon y otros organismos, empresas, fábricas y granjas para felicitar a los obreros, trabajadores agrícolas e intelectuales. 
					
					Los visitantes depositaron ramos de flores ante las estatuas de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung, los retratos de él con amplia sonrisa y los murales mosaicos con imágenes de los Grandes Hombres sin iguales. 
					
					Además, recorrieron los museos de la historia revolucionaria y las salas de presentación del historial que demuestran las imborrables huellas de dirección de los Grandes Hombres. 
					
					Acto seguido, conversaron con los innovadores laborales quienes crean méritos en la marcha por el gran auge, entablaron con los trabajadores diversos juegos deportivos y de recreo como lucha de cuerda, ajedrez y Yut, y presenciaron las funciones artísticas. 
					
					Al final, expresaron la convicción de que todos los trabajadores registrarán grandes innovaciones y saltos en la producción, la construcción y la investigación científica y contribuirán realmente al mejoramiento de los niveles de vida del pueblo y a la construcción de una potencia económica.

articles.title: Tiene lugar en Anju acto central por Primero de Mayo
articles.content:
Tiene lugar en Anju acto central por Primero de Mayo
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar la víspera en el Complejo Químico Juventud de Namhung en Anju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur el acto central por el 121º aniversario del Primero de Mayo, día de los trabajadores de todo el mundo.
					En el conclave participaron Choe Yong Rim, Yang Hyong Sop y otros cuadros, los funcionarios de los órganos del partido y el poder y organizaciones de masas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, beneméritos, innovadores laborales y trabajadores de esta provincia.
					
					Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buró Político del CC del PTC y premier del Consejo de Ministrosde la República Popular Democrática de Corea, en el informe de la ocasión, señaló que los trabajadores coreanos, que celebran su día, envían saludo combativo y firme solidaridad a todos sus colegas del mundo que luchan con vigor con la bandera de justicia, paz e independencia antiimperialista, y continuó:
					
					El Presidente Kim Il Sung presentó a las masas populares, incluyendo la clase obrera, los campesinos y los intelectuales, como dueñas de su destino, el país y la revolución al crear la inmortal ideal Juche y condujo la revolución y la construcción a la brillante victoria movilizando la creatividad y la inagotable fuerza unida de ellas.
					
					La causa del Presidente continúa y se desarrolla exitosamente gracias al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					El Dirigente agrupó firmemente a la clase obrera y amplias masas trabajadoras en torno al Partido del Trabajo de Corea practicando la política de amor, confianza y afabilidad y orientó a la senda de victoria la causa de independencia y la socialista de masas populares con el poderío de unidad monolítica.
					
					Bajo la sabia dirección del partido y el líder, los trabajadores coreanos coronaron las conmovedoras décadas de la revolución coreana con victorias y méritos orgullosos.
					
					Los trabajadores coreanos deben guardar la convicción del Juche y fuerte dignidad nacional, defender el principio revolucionario y el clasista, frustrar rotundamente la brutal campaña de penetración ideo-cultural de los imperialistas y consolidar más el poder político-ideológico de la revolución coreana.
					
					Deben registrar un viraje decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construcción de la gran potencia próspera dinamizando la ofensiva de producción.
					
					En nombre de todos los trabajadores, expreso el apoyo total a la justa lucha de los trabajadores surcoreanos por la independencia antiyanqui, la democratización de la sociedad y la reunificación de la patria.
					
					Los trabajadores coreanos seguirán cumpliendo su misión histórica en defender la paz y la seguridad del mundo y acelerar el cumplimiento de la causa de independencia de la humanidad y se solidarizarán más con los trabajadores de todo el mundo, que aspiran a la independencia bajo la bandera de independencia, paz y amistad.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y el PSR
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y el PSR
						
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el día 2 en esta capital las conversaciones entre la delegación del Partido del Trabajo de Corea (PTC) y la del Partido Socialista de Rumania (PSR).
					En la ocasión estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el secretario del Comité Central del PTC Kim Yong Il, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Ri Yong Chol y otros funcionarios del CC del Partido, y por la rumana, los miembros de la delegación del PSR encabezada por el presidente del Consejo Supremo, Vasile Orleanu.
					
					Ambas partes informaron las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron los criterios sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones entre los dos partidos y otros asuntos de interés mutuo.

MINREX ofrece banquete en honor de embajadores europeos
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 10º aniversario de la visita a Corea de la delegación de máximo nivel de la Unión Europea, la cancillería coreana ofreció el día 2 un banquete en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomático Taedonggang.
					Fueron invitados a la recepción los representantes diplomáticos y otros miembros de las embajadas de los países europeos y los representantes de las representaciones de cooperación de la misma región, acreditados en Corea.
					
					También estuvieron presentes el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung y otros funcionarios de la cancillería coreana.
					
					En la ocasión hubo intervenciones.

articles.title: Obreros celebran acto del Primero de Mayo por la reunificación
articles.content:
Obreros celebran acto del Primero de Mayo por la reunificación
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 121º aniversario del Primero de Mayo, día internacional de los trabajadores, tuvo lugar la víspera en la zona de recreo del islote Rungna el acto de los obreros por la reunificación en demanda de la implementación de la Declaración Conjunta del 15 de Junio y de la paz de la Península Coreana, según lo acordado por las entidades obreras de ambas partes coreanas. 
					Asistieron a la ocasión los funcionarios del Comité Central de la Federación General de los Sindicatos de Corea y trabajadores. 
					
					En medio de la interpretación de la canción "Somos uno", se izó la bandera de reunificación. 
					
					El vicepresidente de la comisión de reunificación del CC de la FGSC, Hong Kwang Hyo, presentó el informe y hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores apuntaron la necesidad de dinamizar el movimiento por la reunificación con las fuerzas unidas de los obreros del Norte y el Sur frustrando tajantemente las maniobras anti-reunificación de las fuerzas separatistas dentro y fuera del país. 
					
					Expresaron apoyo total a la justa lucha de los trabajadores surcoreanos por la independencia antiyanqui, la democratización de la sociedad y los derechos del obrero. 
					
					Acto seguido, se dio a la publicidad la resolución conjunta acordada por las entidades obreras del Norte y el Sur con motivo del Primero de Mayo. 
					
					El texto denuncia las maniobras de las fuerzas anti-reunificación que impidieron la presencia de delegados surcoreanos en el presente acto y persiguen obstinadamente la confrontación fratricida. 
					
					Llama a mantener y ejecutar cabalmente la histórica Declaración Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaración del 4 de Octubre. 
					
					Los obreros del Norte y el Sur deben actuar dinámicamente para rechazar rotundamente todos los actos anti-reunificación y defender la paz, acota. 
					
					Por último, exhorta a fortalecer la solidaridad y la unidad con los partidos políticos, las entidades y las personalidades partidarias de dichas declaraciones íntercoreanas.
